member.name: T:Belcorp.FrameWork.DAF.SqlServer
member.summary: The SqlServer class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of the SqlClient ADO.NET provider. It is created using the abstract factory in AdoHelper.

member.name: T:Belcorp.FrameWork.DAF.AdoHelper
member.summary: The AdoHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common data access uses. It uses the Abstract Factory pattern to be easily extensible to any ADO.NET provider. The current implementation provides helpers for SQL Server, ODBC, OLEDB, and Oracle.

member.name: M:Belcorp.FrameWork.DAF.AdoHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of IDataParameters to an IDbCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of IDataParameterParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:Belcorp.FrameWork.DAF.AdoHelper.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter.
member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command

member.summary: Create and prepare an IDbCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.

If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.

This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: A IDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.param: A valid IDbConnection object
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: A IDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command
